intro: Lophiolepis ligularis, commonly known as the slender lomatium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine by Indigenous peoples. L. ligularis thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
